intro: Geraniospermum reniforme, commonly known as the kidney-shaped geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive kidney-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Geraniospermum reniforme is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
